intro: Strychnos myriantha, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellow or orange berry that contains several seeds. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive palmate venation pattern.
